page.title: 01The Lowlands Around Meare
page.content: The block in question stands in the middle of the "Ancient Vale Of Avalon" and even stands though it is fourteen miles from the coast the average height is four metres above sea-level. Virtually the whole of the block is covered with intensively farmed grassland which overlies a layer of peat reaching a depth of three or four metres. There is a necessity for effective drainage and the whole area is crossed with ditches, drainage channels or "rhymes" as they are called locally. These have divided the landscape into clearly defined rectangular fields. Only a few people are employed directly in agriculture but many more work in neighbouring peat factories. The majority are employed in the nearby towns of Glastonbury and Street. There is some new residential development
